# cellSize(forBounds:)

**Instance Method**

Returns the minimum size needed to display the receiver, constraining it to the specified rectangle.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func cellSize(forBounds rect: NSRect) -> NSSize
```

## Parameters

- **rect**: The size of the cell, or the size of the `aRect` parameter if the cell is not a text or image cell. If the cell is an image cell but no image has been set, returns `NSZeroSize`.

## Discussion

This method takes into account of the size of the image or text within a certain offset determined by the border type of the cell. If the receiver is of text type, the text is resized to fit within `aRect` (as much as `aRect` is within the bounds of the cell).

To support constraint-based layout, when the content of a custom cell changes in such a way that the return value of this method would change, the cell needs to notify its control of the change by calling the control’s [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSControl/invalidateIntrinsicContentSize(for:)] method.

## Determining Cell Size

- **calcDrawInfo(_:)**: Recalculates the cell geometry.
- **cellSize**: The minimum size needed to display the cell.
- **drawingRect(forBounds:)**: Returns the rectangle within which the receiver draws itself
- **imageRect(forBounds:)**: Returns the rectangle in which the receiver draws its image.
- **titleRect(forBounds:)**: Returns the rectangle in which the receiver draws its title text.
- **controlSize**: The size of the cell.
